acute_aquatic_toxicity.hazard_name: Hazardous to the aquatic environment Acute
acute_aquatic_toxicity.rationale: It was classified into Category 2 from 96 hours LC50=5.3mg/L of the fish (Rainbow Trout) (EU-RAR, 2003).

acute_toxicity_dermal.rationale: Based on the rabbit LD50 (dermal route) of over 8,200mg/kg (NICNAS (2001)).

acute_toxicity_inhalation_dust.hazard_name: Acute toxicity Inhalation: Dusts and mists

acute_toxicity_inhalation_gas.rationale: Due to the fact that the substance is "liquid" according to the GHS definition and inhalation of its gas is not expected.

acute_toxicity_inhalation_vapor.rationale: Based on the rat LC50 value of 14,000mg/L (based on a conversion factor (25degC) of 1mg/m3=0.313ppm), calculated from the testing data of rat LC50 (4-hour inhalation) of 44.66mg/L (EHC 150 (1993)), was lower than 90% of the saturated vapour concentration (124,000ppm (25degC)) under a saturated vapour pressure of 12.6kPa (25degC), the substance was considered as "vapour containing substantially no mist" and was classified based on standard values expressed in ppm.

acute_toxicity_oral.rationale: Based on the LD50 value of 1,620mg/kg calculated from the testing data of rat LD50 (oral route) of 810mg/kg (NICNAS (2001), IRIS (2002)), 3,000mg/kg, 3300mg/kg, and 4,900mg/kg, (EHC 150 (1993).

aspiration_hazard.hazard_statement: May be fatal if swallowed and enters airways
aspiration_hazard.rationale: Based on the description in ICSC (J) (2003): "May cause aspiration and chemical pneumonia if swallowed." Based on the fact that benzene is a hydrocarbon and has a dynamic viscosity of 0.740mm2/s (25degC) (CERI calculated value).

carcinogenicity.rationale: Due to the fact that the substance is classified as Category K by NTP (2005), Group 1 by IARC (1987), Category A1 by ACGIH (2001), and Category A by EPA (2000).

chronic_aquatic_toxicity.hazard_name: Hazardous to the aquatic environment Long-term
chronic_aquatic_toxicity.hazard_statement: Toxic to aquatic life with long lasting effects
chronic_aquatic_toxicity.rationale: Although acute toxicity was Category 2 and the bio-accumulation potential was low (log Kow=2.13(PHYSPROP Database, 2005)), since there was no rapidly degrading (the decomposition by BOD: 40%(Existing Chemical Safety Inspections Data)), it was classified into Category 2.

corrosive_to_metals.rationale: Classified into Class 3 (UN Recommendations on the Transport of Dangerous Goods, UN#1114 )

explosives.rationale: Containing no chemical groups with explosive properties

flammable_gases.hazard_name: Flammable gases including chemically unstable gases
flammable_gases.rationale: Classified as "liquid" according to GHS definition

flammable_liquids.rationale: The flash point is -11degC (c.c.) (ICSC, 2004) and the boiling point is 80degC, which is classified into Category 2. Classified into Class 3 and Packing Group II (UN#1114) (UN Recommendations on the Transport of Dangerous Goods)

flammable_solids.rationale: Classified as "liquid" according to GHS definition

gases_under_pressure.rationale: Classified as "liquid" according to GHS definition

germ_cell_mutagenicity.rationale: Based on negative data on multi-generation mutagenicity tests, the absence of data on germ cell mutagenicity tests in vivo, positive data on somatic cell mutagenicity tests in vivo, and the absence of data on germ cell genotoxicity tests in vivo, described in EHC 150 (1993), NTP-TR289 (1986).

oxidizing_gases.rationale: Classified as "liquid" according to GHS definition

oxidizing_liquids.rationale: Organic compounds containing no oxygen, fluorine and chlorine

oxidizing_solids.rationale: Classified as "liquid" according to GHS definition

pyrophoric_liquids.rationale: Not pyrophoric when in contact with air at ordinary temperatures: the auto-ignition temperature is 498degC (ICSC, 2004)

pyrophoric_solids.rationale: Classified as "liquid" according to GHS definition

reproductive_toxicity.hazard_statement: Suspected of damaging fertility or the unborn child
reproductive_toxicity.rationale: Based on evidence of toxicity to foetuses at dosing levels toxic to dams, described in NTP (1986), ATSDR (2005).

self_heating_substances.rationale: Test methods applicable to liquid substances are not available

self_reactive_substances.rationale: Containing no chemical groups with explosive or self-reactive properties

serious_eye_damage_irritation.rationale: Based on the evidence of moderate eye irritation in rabbit eye irritation tests (EHC 150 (1993)), (NICNAS (2001)).

skin_corrosion_irritation.rationale: Based on the description in the report on rabbit primary skin irritation tests (NICNAS (2001) and rabbit cumulative skin irritation tests (EHC 150 (1993)) as well as on EU Risk Phrase Xi; R36/38: Benzene is considered "irritating" to the skin.

skin_sensitizer.rationale: Based on the description in PATTY (4th, 1994): Benzene causes skin sensitization in guinea pigs, though the details of the test methods are unknown; the reliability of the test results has yet to be established (i.e., data are insufficient).

substances_mixtures_emit_flammable_gas_i.hazard_name: Substances and mixtures which, in contact with water, emit flammable gases
substances_mixtures_emit_flammable_gas_i.rationale: Containing no metals or metalloids (B, Si, P, Ge, As, Se, Sn, Sb, Te, Bi, Po, At)

systemic_toxicity_repeat_exposure.hazard_name: Specific target organ toxicity - Repeated exposure
systemic_toxicity_repeat_exposure.hazard_statement: Cause damage to organs through prolonged or repeated exposure (central nervous system, hematopoietic system)
systemic_toxicity_repeat_exposure.rationale: Based on the human evidence including "bone marrow hypoplasia/hyperplasia, hypocytosis associated with normoblast," "blood toxicity," "fatal cases due to aplastic anemia" (EHC 150 (1993)), "transverse myelitis" (IRIS (2002)), "frequent headache, exhaustion, somnipathy, dysmnesia," "a decrease in white/red blood cell counts, an increase in mean cell volume" (NICNAS (2001)), and the evidence from animal studies including "a decrease in lymphocyte/red blood cell counts," "abnormal configuration of circulating erythrocytes and leukocytes," "a decrease in splenic nucleated cells, circulating erythrocytes and lymphocytes; a decrease in white blood cell count," "a decrease in bone marrow cellularity and bone marrow pluripotent cells" (EHC 150 (1993)), "a decrease in red blood cell, white blood cell and lymphocyte counts, a decrease in hematocrit value, an increase in mean cell volume" (IRIS (2002)). The effects on experimental animals were observed at dosing levels within the guidance value ranges for Category 1.

systemic_toxicity_single_exposure.hazard_name: Specific target organ toxicity - Single exposure
systemic_toxicity_single_exposure.hazard_statement:
Causes damage to organs (respiratory system)
May cause drowsiness or dizziness (narcotic effects)
systemic_toxicity_single_exposure.rationale: Based on the human evidence including "irritation to the skin, nose, mouth and larynx; tracheitis, laryngitis, bronchitis, massive pulmonary hemorrhage" ((NICNAS (2001)), and the evidence from animal studies including "respiratory depression during anesthetization" (EHC 150 (1993)).
